psychological_notes: Evan's response reveals the core wound: the belief that sufficient control can prevent suffering. This is the hypervigilance of trauma - the exhausting attempt to manage all variables to avoid pain. His inclusion of 'loved ones' shows how this extends beyond self-protection.
philosophical_underpinning: The Buddhist first noble truth inverted - not 'life contains suffering' but 'I must prevent all suffering'
therapeutic_direction: Identifying control as defensive strategy rather than effective protection
